pageContext.claim: “Congratulations to former Governor of New Jersey, Chris Christie, and all others involved, on a complete and total exoneration (with a 9-0 vote by the U.S. Supreme Court) on the Obama DOJ Scam referred to as 'Bridgegate.'”
pageContext.analysis: The Supreme Court ruling was hardly "complete and total exoneration." The Court actually said what the Christie aides did was corrupt and objectionable — just not a property fraud crime as prosecutors alleged under a certain statute. Moreover, there was no misconduct in this case by Obama's Department of Justice and no one — other than Christie now that the court has ruled — has alleged as much. And that should be taken with a grain of salt, as he disowned knowledge of the scandal and condoned the actions of his aides.
